item.title: Awardpc command of myn... needs 1 fix
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“awardpc”))
{
if (!playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“kenshin”))
{
return;
}
String[] args = command.split(" “);
String name = args[1];
client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name.replaceAll(”_", " "))];

	c.pcpoint += Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
	c.sendMessage("Kenshin awarded you " + args[2] + " PC Points.");
}[/code]

Usage: awardpc la_lampara 50

Read full topic
item.source: Awardpc command of myn... needs 1 fix

item.title: Awardpc command of myn... needs 1 fix
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Alright, the only problem with it is if for example I do,
::awardpc la lampara 50
it wont give anything, because of that space in the name. if i do
::awardpc zeni 50
it will work because there is no space. How can i get that to read the space?

if (command.startsWith("awardpc") && command.length() > 5 && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Kenshin")) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
            String name = (args[1]);
		int pointsgiven = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
            client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)];
		c.pcpoint += (pointsgiven);
               c.sendMessage("Kenshin awarded you " +pointsgiven+ " PC Points");
               c.sendMessage("Dont spend it all in one place.");
}

Read full topic
